IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDesc: THE ORGANIZATION WAS INCORPORATED AS A NOT-FOR-PROFIT ORGANIZATION TO PROVIDE LEADERSHIP AND SERVICES IN HEALTHCARE NECESSARY TO IMPROVE THE HEALTH STATUS OF ALL CITIZENS IN THE COMMUNITIES SERVED.
IRS990.MissionDesc: THE ORGANIZATION'S MISSION IS A COMMITMENT TO PROVIDE QUALITY PRIMARY HEALTHCARE TO PATIENTS IN ITS SERVICE AREA. THE ORGANIZATION WAS INCORPORATED AS A NOT-FOR-PROFIT ORGANIZATION TO DEVELOP AND ADMINISTER COMPREHENSIVE HEALTH CARE AND SUPPORT SERVICES TO RESIDENTS IN AND AROUND TALIFERRO, GLASCOCK, BIBB, TELFAIR, BALDWIN, HANCOCK, WARREN, JEFFSON, JOHNSON, WASHINGTON, WILKINSON, LAURENS, JONES, AND TWIGGS COUNTIES IN GEORGIA. THE ORGANIZATION OPERATES ITS HEALTH CENTERS WITH A COMMITMENT TO PROVIDING QUALITY HEALTH CARE SERVICES TO ITS PATIENTS.
IRS990.Desc: THE CENTER PROVIDED PRIMARY HEALTH CARE TO MOSTLY LOW INCOME PATIENTS. DURING THE FISCAL YEAR ENDING APRIL 30, 2022, THE CENTER SERVED 47,047 PATIENTS PER THE MEDICARE COST REPORT. AS REFLECTED ON THE ANNUAL UDS REPORT FOR THE CALENDAR YEAR ENDED DECEMBER 31,2021, THE CLINIC EXPERIENCED 107,823 CLINIC AND VIRTUAL VISITS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: SCHEDULE D, PAGE 2, PART V, LINE 4
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: ENDOWMENT FUNDS ARE INTENDED FOR CAPITAL PURCHASES AND TECHNOLOGY EXPANSION.

THE ORGANIZATION IS A NOT-FOR-PROFIT CORPORATION THAT HAS BEEN RECOGNIZED AS TAX-EXEMPT PURSUANT TO SECTION 501(C)(3) OF THE INTERNAL REVENUE CODE. THE ORGANIZATION APPLIES ACCOUNTING POLICIES THAT PRESCRIBE WHEN TO RECOGNIZE AND HOW TO MEASURE THE FINANCIAL STATEMENT EFFECTS OF INCOME TAX POSITIONS TAKEN OR EXPECTED TO BE TAKEN ON ITS INCOME TAX RETURNS. THESE RULES REQUIRE MANAGEMENT TO EVALUATE THE LIKELIHOOD THAT, UPON EXAMINATION BY THE RELEVANT TAXING JURISDICTIONS, THOSE INCOME TAX POSITIONS WOULD BE SUSTAINED. BASED ON THAT EVALUATION, THE ORGANIZATION ONLY RECOGNIZES THE MAXIMUM BENEFIT OF EACH INCOME TAX POSITION THAT IS MORE THAN 50% LIKELY OF BEING SUSTAINED. TO THE EXTENT THAT ALL OR A PORTION OF THE BENEFITS OF AN INCOME TAX POSITION ARE NOT RECOGNIZED, A LIABILITY WOULD BE RECOGNIZED FOR THE UNRECOGNIZED BENEFITS, ALONG WITH ANY INTEREST AND PENALTIES THAT WOULD RESULT FROM DISALLOWANCE OF THE POSITION. SHOULD ANY SUCH PENALTIES AND INTEREST BE INCURRED, THEY WOULD BE RECOGNIZED AS OPERATING EXPENSES. BASED ON THE RESULTS OF MANAGEMENT'S EVALUATION, NO LIABILITY IS RECOGNIZED IN THE ACCOMPANYING BALANCE SHEETS FOR UNRECOGNIZED INCOME TAX POSITIONS. FURTHER, NO INTEREST OR PENALTIES HAVE BEEN ACCRUED OR CHARGED TO EXPENSE AS OF APRIL 30, 2022 AND 2021, OR FOR THE YEARS THEN ENDED. THE ORGANIZATION'S TAX RETURNS ARE SUBJECT TO POSSIBLE EXAMINATION BY THE TAXING AUTHORITIES. FOR FEDERAL INCOME TAX PURPOSES, THE TAX RETURNS ESSENTIALLY REMAIN OPEN FOR POSSIBLE EXAMINATION FOR A PERIOD OF THREE YEARS AFTER THE RESPECTIVE FILING DEADLINES OF THOSE RETURNS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: SCHEDULE D, PAGE 4, PART XI, LINE 2D
SCHEDULE D, PAGE 4, PART XI, LINE 4B
SCHEDULE D, PAGE 4, PART XII, LINE 4B
SCHEDULE I, PAGE 1, PART I, LINE 2
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE GRANTEE IS A SUBRECIPIENT OF A U.S. DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH & HUMAN SERVICES HEALTH RESOURCES AND SERVICES ADMINISTRATION GRANT AWARDED AS PART OF THE AFFORDABLE CARE ACT FOR NEW AND EXPANDED SERVICES UNDER THE HEALTH CENTER PROGRAM. AS SUCH, BOTH ORGANIZATIONS ARE BOUND TO FEDERAL REPORTING REQUIREMENTS.

THE ORGANIZATION'S MISSION IS A COMMITMENT TO PROVIDE QUALITY PRIMARY HEALTHCARE TO PATIENTS IN ITS SERVICE AREA. THE ORGANIZATION WAS INCORPORATED AS A NOT-FOR-PROFIT ORGANIZATION TO DEVELOP AND ADMINISTER COMPREHENSIVE HEALTH CARE AND SUPPORT SERVICES TO RESIDENTS IN AND AROUND TALIFERRO, GLASCOCK, BIBB, TELFAIR, BALDWIN, HANCOCK, WARREN, JEFFSON, JOHNSON, WASHINGTON, WILKINSON, LAURENS, JONES, AND TWIGGS COUNTIES IN GEORGIA. THE ORGANIZATION OPERATES ITS HEALTH CENTERS WITH A COMMITMENT TO PROVIDING QUALITY HEALTH CARE SERVICES TO ITS PATIENTS.

THE CEO AND CFO REVIEW THE FORM 990 WITH THE OUTSIDE PAID PREPARER PRIOR TO FILING. MANAGEMENT PRESENTS A COPY OF THE FORM 990 TO SELECTED BOARD MEMBERS BEFORE IT IS FILED. THE ENTIRE BOARD DOES NOT RECEIVE A COPY OF THE FORM 990.

BOARD MEMBER AND EMPLOYEES ARE PERMITTED TO ENGAGE IN NON-CLINIC ACTIVITIES THAT ARE RECREATIONAL OR REMUNERATIVE, THAT INCREASE PERSONAL OR PROFESSIONAL DEVELOPMENT, OR THAT LEND SERVICE TO THE COMMUNITY WITH THE LIMITATION THAT THESE ACTIVITIES WILL NOT SIGNIFICANTLY INTERFERE WITH THE OPERATIONS OF THE CLINIC. A CONFLICT OF INTEREST STATEMENT IS COMPLETED ANNUALLY DISCLOSING ANY POTENTIAL CONFLICTS. VIOLATION OF THE CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY IS GROUNDS FOR DISCIPLINARY ACTION APPROPRIATE TO THE VIOLATION, UP TO AND INCLUDING TERMINATION.

THE PERSONNEL COMMITTEE OF THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS REVIEWS THE CEO'S PERFORMANCE AND SALARY AND SETS THE CEO'S SALARY ANNUALLY. THE CEO REVIEWS THE CFO'S PERFORMANCE AND SETS THE CFO'S SALARY ANNUALLY.

THE ORGANIZATION MAKES ITS FORM 1023 AND FORM 990 AVAILABLE FOR PUBLIC INSPECTION UPON REQUEST AT ITS OFFICES. THE ORGANIZATION MAKES ITS GOVERNING DOCUMENTS, CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY AND FINANCIAL STATEMENTS AVAILABLE TO THE PUBLIC UPON REQUEST AT ITS OFFICES.
